channel.title: The Ark
channel.description: The Ark is the weekly newspaper of Tiburon, Belvedere and Strawberry

item.title: Frogs delay, rats play — Point Tiburon Marsh condos are caught in the middle
item.description: Tiburon to remove invasive weeds at Railroad Marsh after condo residents report rat infestation linked to overgrown vegetation behind units.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Belvedere film fest returns with 32 community-made shorts
item.description: Homemade films showcase community stories at festival in Belvedere Community Park Oct. 10.
item.dc:creator: Tyler Callister

item.title: Strawberry journalist creates studio to capture life stories on film
item.description: Journalist Priya David Clemens launches studio to create personal documentaries. Her first film profiles Tiburon surgeon Angelo Capozzi.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Town Hall, library could combine as joint hub for residents in emergencies
item.description: Local officials plan microgrid connecting Town Hall and library for emergency power during natural disasters and public safety shutoffs.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Everyday Encounter: A couple savors the moment on shores of Richardson Bay
item.description: Wade and Norleak Winblad find tranquility along Richardson Bay, reflecting on simple living and appreciating everyday moments.
item.dc:creator: Francisco Martinez

item.title: Triathlete and finance veteran joins Strawberry Rec board
item.description: Triathlete Doug Twillman joins Strawberry Rec board, bringing 40 years of financial experience to help oversee district operations.
item.dc:creator: Tyler Callister

item.title: Apple design icon Jony Ive buys four Belvedere homes for $73 million
item.description: The off-market deal includes historic Locksley Hall, now twice Marin’s priciest-ever sale.
item.dc:creator: Tyler Callister
